intro: Poikilogyne diastematica, commonly known as the variable-leaf starwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its alternate, lance-shaped leaves that vary in size and shape, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it thrives in moist, often calcareous soils. Poikilogyne diastematica is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
